page.title: 01An Introduction to the Area.
page.content: ur area is one of outstanding natural beauty,situated in the Chilterns and close to the River Thames.The nearest towns are Henley and Marlow.The area is sparsely populated and is protected by the National Trust.Most of the buildings are at least 80 years old with the exception of a large house which was built in 1981.Hamble Brook runs through the centre of the block. Its source is at Skirmett and it flows into the River Thames at Mill End.The brook dried up in 1984 but it is flowing strongly now.In Hambleden village there is an inn,post-office, general store,a butcher,a garage and 2 churches.Most of the block is owned by Lord Hambleden who resides at the Manor. It is an agricultural area and there are 7 farmers in the block.
